p.s: The side-character Helen from the book Gun Love is aan 8 year old girl, who is in the same foster home as Pearl.
Helen is a very small girl that looks like a five year old (l. 2).
She smells like burned marshmallows (l. 3) and is very energic.
You can say that she is acting very silly because she dreams of a white Christmas in Florida (ll. 18-19) which is almost impossible.
It is also very obvious that she is confused about her own life because she doesn't really know where she came from (ll. 7-8).
She is confused because there were too many changes in her life.
The narrator calls her a true-blue foster child because she was in too many homes (l. 11).
The fact that she stayed in homes where she only got cereals to eat (l. 14) and that she doesn't drink enough water (l. 19) shows us that she is probably very skinny and undernourished.
Even though her life is very hard she is still happy and can be childish, which you can tell from the questions she asks her friends.
Helen pointed out a few times that she had to deal with bugs which shows that she lived under bad conditions (ll. 21-22).
She even recognized the smell of bug-off on Pearl, which is a clue for her living conditions.
You can also tell that the familysfamilies she lived at weren't rich because she had to reuse dental floss and tea bags.
Helen is looking for love from others as you can see from her love for forehead kisses.
She likes to have contact to others (l. 19, l. 41).
The fact that Helen speaks in 3rd person to herself shows that she isn't educated.
She has a few friends that she talks to with her phones.
They talk about simple questions which shows that her friends aren't much older than her.
She had been in 17 foster homes as you can see from the number of her phones.
She doesn't have a good relationship to all of them because she doesn't know what house the phones belong to.
She was in familysfamilies with other religions or ethnic groups (ll. 6-10).
Her familysfamily's didn't care enough for her because they didn't teach her the most important things.
